page.title: 12Local Customs
page.content: {Hallowe'en.}Each year on the 31st October local youngsters dress up as witches and ghosts and call upon neighbours.Very often they carry with them a turnip lantern. {Weddings.}It is the custom for children to tie up the church gates when a couple have been married.When coins are thrown over the gates they are untied. {Mischief Night.}Each year on the 4th November it is the custom for local children and youths to get up to pranks in the village.It is quite common for garden gates to be removed. {Bonfire Night.}Each year on the 5th November a bonfire and fireworks' display is held in Catterick Village. In 1985 Guy Fawkes was remembered with a bonfire and fireworks at R.A.F. Catterick.This event was open to all local families free of charge.
